Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the potential harm of eating persimmons with yoghurt and banana by stating that it is poisonous.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks scientific evidence or support to back up its assertion that eating these foods together is poisonous.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the death of a boy on his way to the hospital was caused by eating persimmons with yoghurt and banana, without providing any evidence or establishing a causal link.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the statements of health experts who state that there is no scientific evidence to suggest that these foods are harmful when consumed together.
